intro: Ixia monadelpha var. curta, commonly known as the short-stemmed African daffodil, is a striking ornamental plant native to South Africa. It features bright yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single flower per stem, which is characteristic of the Ixia genus. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its vibrant color and compact size, it is a popular choice for adding a splash of color to gardens.
